title: dependence_plot messes up the figure layout where multiple axes are used

labels.name: todo
labels.description: This issue had an outstanding action to take.

body:
When I am trying to draw multiple plots in one figure, the layout is messed up:
1. firstly the position of the bar on the right becomes "global" for the figure
2. only the 1st ax is treated correctly

Below is the code to reproduce it on any dataset/model. Sorry, I cannot fix the code formatting...

`explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)
top_inds = np.argsort(-np.sum(np.abs(shap_values), 0))

n_len = len(features)
plots_n = 4
    
l = np.int(np.ceil(n_len / plots_n))

f, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(30, l*3))
axes = [b for a in axes for b in a]    # flatten axes

for i in range(n_len):
    shap.dependence_plot(top_inds[i], shap_values, X_num, display_features=X_num, ax=axes[i])
    axes[i].set_title(f'{features[top_inds[i]]}')

for ax in axes[i+1:]:         # delete unused plots
    f.delaxes(ax)

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()`
